sub_topic: Determine the Lie derivative of a vector field on a manifold.
message_1: Let $M$ be the manifold with local coordinates $(x,y,z)$ and let $X=2x\frac{\partial}{\partial x}-y\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}$ be a vector field on $M$. Determine the Lie derivative of $X$ with respect to the vector field $Y=2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x}+x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+\frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}$ on $M$.
message_2:
To compute the Lie derivative of the vector field $X$ with respect to the vector field $Y$, we use the Lie bracket of vector fields, which is defined as:

$$[Y, X] = Y(X) - X(Y)$$

First, we compute the action of $Y$ on $X$:

$$Y(X) = 2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x}(2x\frac{\partial}{\partial x}-y\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}) + x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}(2x\frac{\partial}{\partial x}-y\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}) + \frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}(2x\frac{\partial}{\partial x}-y\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+z\frac{\partial}{\partial z})$$

$$= 2y\left(2\frac{\partial}{\partial x}\right) + x\left(-\frac{\partial}{\partial y}\right) + \frac{1}{3}z\left(\frac{\partial}{\partial z}\right)$$

$$= 4y\frac{\partial}{\partial x} - x\frac{\partial}{\partial y} + \frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}$$

Next, we compute the action of $X$ on $Y$:

$$X(Y) = 2x\frac{\partial}{\partial x}(2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x}+x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+\frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}) - y\frac{\partial}{\partial y}(2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x}+x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+\frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}) + z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}(2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x}+x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}+\frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z})$$

$$= 2x\left(2\frac{\partial}{\partial y}\right) - y\left(2\frac{\partial}{\partial x}\right) + z\left(\frac{1}{3}\frac{\partial}{\partial z}\right)$$

$$= 4x\frac{\partial}{\partial y} - 2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x} + \frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}$$

Now, we compute the Lie bracket $[Y, X] = Y(X) - X(Y)$:

$$[Y, X] = \left(4y\frac{\partial}{\partial x} - x\frac{\partial}{\partial y} + \frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}\right) - \left(4x\frac{\partial}{\partial y} - 2y\frac{\partial}{\partial x} + \frac{1}{3}z\frac{\partial}{\partial z}\right)$$

$$= (4y + 2y)\frac{\partial}{\partial x} + (-x - 4x)\frac{\partial}{\partial y}$$

$$= 6y\frac{\partial}{\partial x} - 5x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}$$

Thus, the Lie derivative of $X$ with respect to the vector field $Y$ is:

$$\mathcal{L}_Y X = [Y, X] = 6y\frac{\partial}{\partial x} - 5x\frac{\partial}{\partial y}$$
